column3:
I really like the idea of not hardcoding the architecture in the descriptor.

Maybe we could change gitian instead, to use the local architecture, so simply use the existing amd64 base image, when 'linux64' is used in the descriptor, assuming it is running on amd64.

> Also, the gititan builds wouldn't be deterministic across arches anyway, see #17468

That is probably worth investigat

### Gitian builds | File | commit 21ee676dd6a7d9704367b6412bf8e1e443ec2b5b
(master) | commit 664bc9759ff26da8e85f461c580089bcd6d8b482
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | bitcoin-0.19.99-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz | [`82564312bb7411d9...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/21ee676dd6a7d9704367b6412bf8e1e443ec2b5b/bitcoin-0.19.99-
Labeled this for 0.20 so we can merge it if no other changes are done to gitian to support architecture-independent builds.
Going to merge this now, because I'd like to see https://bitcoin.jonasschnelli.ch/ working before the release of 0.20. \n\nPing @jonasschnelli :smiling_imp:
